content.raw: The compelling reason is when a normal link is connected by a joint to a fixed frame. Currently we specify this with `<parent>world</parent>`. Then we have to put special logic in all the joint classes when they try to get the parent link of a joint and receive a null pointer instead. I'm not sure reference frames would be enough for that.
